item.title: TheSTAGE 2017
item.dc:creator: sage
item.content:encoded:
SAGE Canada is proud to introduce TheSTAGE: National Competition 2016, which will be held on Friday, May 13th. The competition is in search for the TOP 12 socially innovative youth ventures nationwide, to compete at our national stage for a chance to represent Canada globally as youth entrepreneurs. This years winners will have the chance to compete against 21 participating countries in Ukraine.

Dress code
Finalists: Business professional
Judges: Business casual

Contact Info: janice.wang@ryerson.ca

Students for the Advancement of Global Entrepreneurship (SAGE) Canada is a non-profit organization led by dedicated post-secondary students, housed within Ryerson University. SAGE strives to advance youth development and community engagement, while untiring an innovative environment.

Youth between the ages of 13 to 18 are provided with education assistance resources, ad one-on-one mentorship to take their ideas to the next level and start their own business ventures. they are taught the importance of emphasizing ethical business practices, social responsibility, civic engagement, and environment awareness.

GET YOUR IDEA OUT INTO THE WORLD

Our program will teach you all the different elements involved in becoming a successful entrepreneur. We provide our students with in-depth experience in business development. At SAGE we pride ourselves in promoting equal opportunity, keeping our program free and accessible for all high school students.

We have a team of mentors who are dedicated to your success. At the end of our program you get an opportunity to compete in a global competition. This experience not only leaves you with a fuller of understanding of the world of entrepreneurship, but with a network you can take with you anywhere.
Still have questions? Visit our FAQ page or contact us anytime

after the filtering process, the top 12 teams are given a chance to have one-on-one preparation for the upcoming National competition.

item.title: Leadership Summit
item.dc:creator: sage
item.content:encoded: The leaders of each SAGE team are invited to be trained on how to successfully lead and motivate their peers.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The leaders of each SAGE team are invited to be trained ion how to successfully lead and motivate their peers. The day will be composed of workshops and activities that will focus on the soft skills necessary to manage a team. Leaders will come out of this feeling confident to engage their team.

The event is designed to challenge the mind and create/expand on the ideas that students have for their business ventures. They will get the chance to learn the process of design thinking through workshops, while the rest of the day is there for them to work on their business.
Held in March, the top 12 tams will be determined through a virtual pitch competition to find this year's best ideas to compete in our nationwide competition.
Students compete to showcase their businesses in their respective categories. This even determines the National Champions who will represent Canada in the SAGE Global Competition.
